issue.title: [Packaging] Should we maintain the Arch linux repository?
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-13308](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-13308). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:
One thing that came up in ARROW-13192 is [that Arrow on the the archlinux repo](https://archlinux.org/packages/community/x86_64/arrow/) is out of date. 

Arch linux isn't listed as a supported / maintained distribution, and as far as I can see we don't have any CI infrastructure that tests against it.
